articles.title: Global investors turn to Chinese AI as Wall Street fears bubble
articles.mainIdea: Global investors turn to Chinese AI as Wall Street fears bubble
articles.summary: Reuters: Global investors turn to Chinese AI as Wall Street fears bubble. Global investors are increasing their wagers on Chinese artificial intelligence companies, betting on the next DeepSeek and seeking to diversify, with concerns growing about a speculative bubble in the sector on Wall Street. articles.title: How Investors Are Reacting To Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) New AI Leadership Moves And Alibaba Accelerator Prospects
articles.mainIdea: How Investors Are Reacting To Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) New AI Leadership Moves And Alibaba Accelerator Prospects
articles.summary: Simply Wall St.: How Investors Are Reacting To Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) New AI Leadership Moves And Alibaba Accelerator Prospects. In mid-December 2025, Advanced Micro Devices appointed Emily Ellis as Corporate Vice President and Chief Accounting Officer, while oncology AI firm 4D Path announced a collaboration using AMD EPYC CPUs on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure to power its QPOR clinical trial platform. These developments highlight AMD’s push to pair leadership hires with deeper AI and healthcare workloads, reinforcing its role inside cloud-based, CPU-driven AI infrastructure.
